title: Why are bottom ADCs always AD?
body:
No, saying "Coz ADC stands for ATTACK DAMAGE carry and AD is ATTACK DAMAGE u scrub!!!!" does not count as answering the question >:(

Why are the bottom carries always AD guys with guns or bows? Is AD inherently better than AP lategame, while AP simply works better at early game, thus making all AP carries go to mid and all AD carries go to bot for the support? I doubt it because Zed exists in mid.

Why don't AP champs get supports?

replies.body:
To make it EXTREMELY basic: AD's scale with items, AP's scale with levels

Mid lane champs work better when they don't have a support "leaching" experience since they want to hit that level 6 power spike ASAP.
Top lane champs are usually ones that can take care of themselves and don't need a baby sit.
Marksman however, if they didn't have supports, they would die to almost every gank since they are squishy and require items to do damage.

I however, have thought a long the same lines as you. Like if the team is all AD, why not go Ziggs or Twisted Fate bottom? A ranged AP Carry.
The answer I was told, was simply DPS. You don't want all burst damage, you want people who are capable of doing damage "safely and consistently". Basically ranged auto attackers.
So unless you want to go Attack Speed Ziggs or something, the meta won't be changing anytime soon.

This is, after 5 years of people playing, the most efficient way to set up a team in terms of gold and damage distribution.
i just fuk the meta and play vlad botlane

We poked Ashe and Thresh out of lane and they went really really REALLY far behind. The mid was Vel'Koz so it didn't take them much time to buy boots, however, and the jungle messed us up as our movement speed was so horrible we couldn't escape even if we caught him in our wards.

We won anyways because 3 AP carries with all AoE is OP.

#ScrewTheMetaIndeed

Take distortion boots of mobility and Luden's Echo on Xerath along with ghost and Rabadon with heal/clarity on LeBlanc for 0 MIA without needing teleport at all. Add blue buff. GG.

As far as I'm aware, it's because they're more dependent on basic attacks, which scale off AD. For bot lane you have the Marksman and the Support, and in the early stages of the game marksman champions are more vulnerable. Essentially, they need to be "carried" to get to a point where they are capable of carrying. The difference between bot lane and mid lane champions is that mid lane champions are usually high burst, high damage champions (Mostly Mages and Assassins) and are less reliant on being carried early game, whereas bot lane champions are for more sustained fights where they can get off lots of basic attacks and abilities over a longer period of time.

I see the occasional AP down bot and the occasional adc in mid, both can work depends on the champ and the counter, main problem I find is mana issues which makes it hard to farm down bot as quick as the enemy adc also hard to farm without pushing the lane.

But in the end they did a trade and Bang had Urgot and Faker had Cassiopeia. I see it in many Famous teams. They try to balance it out. Hope that helped

Buffs, Jungle Gold & XP are important/give you an advantage against a no Jungle enemy team;

Hence Junglers are born.
Junglers pressure the map, hence warding is born (Supports are excellent at keeping people alive and better than any other role with little gold hence 0 cs ward bots.
AD Carries (Also know as carry me im squishy's) are born - along with 0 cs ward bots as Supports excel at protecting and aiding allies and AD have the best late game scaling of all.
Mid laners with kill potential work best because of the strong roam potential and often the latest scaling mid laner possible is wanted so as to capitalize on the safe lane (shortest retreat to turret distance on the map) however this often allows heavy counter-picking so often mid-gamers are taken (You really want to capitalize on this safety but an early gamer will smash you so often mid-gamers are taken and most of these are Ability Power based) and you are also close to blue buff (More incentive to play an AP as they have a lot of spells and use a lot of mana in most cases) however there are a lot of variations on mid and being a good roamer is often more important than scaling into late game (Hence a lot of early-mid gamers are taken mid) but most of the reasoning on picks mid is: How safe am I, can I get blue buff and Can I gank hence the 3 main types of mid laner: Burst, Late-game and Poke - most pokers are AP, most late-gamers are AP or AD and most bursters are AP - mid laner picks vary a lot and a big choice is what Jungler do you have as a mana dependent jungler can change your options in mid lane immensely and your pick is probably one of the most important in the game so you should probably go for a mid-gamer so you are less reliant on blue buff leaving blue buff junglers as an option, semi-able to deal with poke and able to capitalize on enemy late gamers to some extent hence causing a sort of stalemate In mid lane at the expense of a slightly larger disadvantage or advantage depending. (Less risk, less reward) because with how important mid lane is its often not a good idea to take risks.
Top laners that are good at tanking or crowd controlling work will with most teams following this setup hence tanky/sustained top laners are born.

You can read more about the meta here:

http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3112440

But the ADC and support meta IIRC originated on EU West servers however the mid laner and Support/Late gamer bot meta was born in DotA and for basic reasons (similar team composition idea to above) and was often switched up with support/late gamer top and was very dependent on switching out of unfavourable matchups etc much as the meta is now.

Bot lane there is constant fighting/dueling/trading. AP champions rely on mana, and would quickly oom in bot lane. AD carries do not rely on mana. Ad champions also allow you to take dragon much quicker than AP.
